forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. Southwest wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. Southwest wind 6 to 9 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The air hangs heavy with moisture and the palpable scent of rain permeates the bustling streets of Downtown San Francisco this afternoon. A thick, gray shroud envelops the city, promising persistent rain as the temperature gently descends to a brisk fifty-seven. Despite the fading afternoon light, the winds whisper softly from the southwest, while the assurance of a hundred percent chance of precipitation looms overhead, hinting that those brave souls venturing outdoors should be equipped with umbrellas and raincoats. The forecast suggests a continuation of this wet symphony into the night, with temperatures creeping up slightly to a cozy fifty-two as gusts of wind playfully tease the edges of comfort.

Beneath this opaque ceiling, visibility is precious, with hints of the fog creeping in alongside the rain's steadiness. The marine layer, ominously pressed against the hills, swathes the iconic Golden Gate Bridge, transforming the familiar skyline into a mysterious silhouette against the elements. It would be wise to embrace the indoor comforts of a favorite café or the intrigue of an artful exhibit, where the warmth of a well-brewed coffee or the flicker of creative inspiration can provide refuge from the dreary exterior. A stroll through the intimate streets, tucked into a warm layer, might lead you to discover the city's charm, hidden just beneath the surface of these overcast skies.
